attributes.action: Make all drone pilots subject to licensing and create a register of owners
attributes.background: With the danger posed by some irresponsible drone pilots, the govt should pass laws to regulate purchases of these items, licence pilots after they have passed a proficiency test, have registration documents for each drone and have gps tracking fitted so that a flight log is maintained.
attributes.additional_details: Yet again we have flight delays due to irresponsible owners flying drones close to airports.  We have already had drones flying dangerously close to aircraft and, apart from the inconvenience that is experienced by the public due to this, it is a real threat to human life.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Ban (military grade armour piercing) 0.50 or higher calibre rifles in the UK
attributes.background:
Despite the overwhelming support for strict gun control in the United Kingdom the Government is failing to ban certain military-grade guns in its new Offensive Weapons Bill.

This is unacceptable and places the British public at direct risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2017-19/offensiveweapons.html

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-politics-46377250

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/government-ban-50-caliber-offensive-weapons-bill-sajid-javid-violence-a8657046.html

attributes.action: Call to ban ‘cruel’ pupil restraint in special schools
attributes.background: Hundreds of children have suffered injuries while being physically restrained in special schools. Teachers throw children to the ground, hold them so tightly it still hurts the next day and don’t talk to them when they are in distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Something has to be done. 
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39530915

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Require dining establishments (restaurants, bars, pubs) to offer metal straws.
attributes.background: In response to the problem of an ever-increasing amount of plastic waste polluting our environment, we need to make restaurants, bars, pubs and any similar establishments offer metal straws as a substitution for plastic straws. This will benefit our planet, dining establishments and customers alike.
attributes.additional_details: Metal straws are a better alternative to paper straws as they are reusable. Similar to dishware including mugs and glasses, metal straws can be washed and reused. Therefore, the use of metal straws will produce no waste. The reusable nature of metal straws also provide financial benefits for the establishments as it is a one-time purchase. Furthermore, it addresses the 'soggy' issue of paper straws providing a practical alternative that all people can use.

attributes.action: Change Planning Laws on Fences to require a 300mm Hole on each side for Wildlife
attributes.background: Today most New Houses have FULLY enclosed rear gardens with high fences down to the ground, seeing our Wildlife is in Decline it makes sense to help them out with these Holes so they can Roam around as they should, Humans have and keep taking away their Habitat, Hedgehogs for one do a lot of good.
attributes.additional_details:
Concrete Gravel Boards need to have one Manufactured with a Hole, wooden fences need the same when sat on the ground, Humans must try to Protect Wildlife for future Generations or we are Selfish.
 
Please Support this as our Wildlife would Appreciate it.

attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to leave children under 13 home alone
attributes.background: There is currently no age restriction for a child being given the responsibility of staying at home alone as long as it’s not overnight and that isn’t “in a manner likely to cause unnecessary suffering or injury to health”.
attributes.additional_details:
This is NOT right, there are a range of issues including safeguarding of children. As parents and carers we have a duty to our children.

The petition is aimed to try to implement a law that states that no child under the age of 13 should be left alone at any given time, the reason for this is due to safeguarding and putting a huge responsibility on children regardless of their mental age. We are not allowed to leave children alone overnight and the same rules must apply throughout the day too. I understand a child must be given due responsibility but under the age of 13 should not be allowed due to risks and safety.

attributes.action: Allow UK students to use student loans within the EU - OR lower tuition fees
attributes.background: The conservative government in power should allow UK students to use their student loans to study at universities within the EU after Brexit OR lower our tuition fee's to minimize out debt for an education we surely need if the country is going to function without EU professional workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The freedom of information responses compiled by the Liberal Democrats from 80 of the 136 NHS acute trusts in England shows that 2,700 EU nurses left the health service in 2016, compared to 1,600 EU nurses in 2014 – a 68% increase.

If leaving the EU means letting go of many of our much-needed professionals, the UK university tuition fees need to either be lowered or student loans need to allow our youth to study where it's cheaper.

The average student debt at graduation is £50,800 - source IFS.

Do we really expect our youngest and brightest to thrive with that much debt on their shoulders?

attributes.action: Make the NHS exempt from paying business rates.
attributes.background: NHS Hospitals are facing rising business rates whilst private hospitals are able to register as a charity saving them around 80% on their business rates.

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS workers  to pay for registration renewel
attributes.background: I want action because NHS workers shouldn’t have to pay to go to work. They work long hours with stretched resources, often their is not enough staff with little opportunity for breaks. Both my parents work for the NHS, with my mother having been part of the service for more than 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Renewing registration can cost practitioners in the NMC £120 per year and practitoners in the hcpc costs £180 for two years registration. They pay the fee despite wage rises being frozen for two years from 2011, and increases capped at 1% until this year. However, despite the proposed pay increases this won’t cover the registration fee and is minimal in comparison to inflation.

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Review impact of the Help-to-Buy scheme and take action to address failings
attributes.background:
Has H2B been targeted at the right people?
Have H2B prices been over-inflated?
Can H2B owners afford their equity loan/remortgage?
Has H2B benefitted house-builders fairly?
Are H2B houses of a suitable quality?

and many more questions to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/feb/26/persimmon-profits-help-to-buy-scheme

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-47372385

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/help-to-buy-housing-scheme-government-benefits-high-earners-property-prices-labour-a8372961.html

https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/mortgageshome/article-6107805/Are-developers-inflating-prices-homes-sold-Help-Buy.html

attributes.action: Change sure start grant to 1 claim per family instead of first child only
attributes.background: We had our first child and wasn’t eligible for sure start maternity grant as we was both working we will soon be having a second child, we was told we are not eligible for the grant as we already have a child under 16 but we have never claimed it before
attributes.additional_details: I want to change it so that families can claim it for 1 child no matter weather it’s there 1st or 4th child

attributes.action: Mandatory motorway driving tuition for all learners.
attributes.background:
Driving tuition is currently only carried out in towns and cities, reverse parking and 3 point turns are all well and good but it is time all learners were instructed to drive safely on motorways.
Motorway driving is completely different to urban and city driving, lets all make them a safer place.

attributes.action: GCSEs to be replaced by a mix of academic and vocational subjects at A-levels.
attributes.background: I have been a secondary teacher for many years and I think the current GCSEs belong to an era when young people left education at 16. Let's have a baccalaureate system to replace A-levels, with a mix of arts, sciences and vocational subjects and exams at the age of 18.

attributes.action: Lower the recommended age for a cervical smear test to 18.
attributes.background: The recommended age to conduct a smear test to prevent cervical cancer is currently 25 years old. In some tragic cases, this is too late in life and the cancer may have already spread. My aim is to get as many signatures in, and get the age lowered.
attributes.additional_details: 18 is a good age as the body has almost finished growing.

attributes.action: For Parliament to urgently debate how it will restore Public Trust in Politics
attributes.background: Are Politicians aware of the scale of collapse in public trust in politics? It’s the immediate and greatest threat to our democracy, yet they never talk of it. There is a real fear for Society if trust in politics is not rebuilt urgently. How this debate is used will define the future of generations
attributes.additional_details: This debate is the opportunity to recognise how they lost public trust and what they must do now to persuade the public to trust again. This crisis of trust has been building over decades and has only served to make current events even more polarising. Now only 19% of the public trust Politicians to tell the truth (Ipsos MORI). Trust will not be found in new policies, committees or changing our constitution, but only by each politician taking personal responsibility to rebuild it, as a priority

attributes.action: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2.
attributes.background: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2. A UK peoples' vote is required. The likely 100B GBP could be spent on other local transportation requirements which offer a better ROI, and solve real transportation issues.

attributes.action: Headteachers to be re-elected by staff, parents and governors every year.
attributes.background: It should be made mandatory for Headteachers to be re-elected by staff, parents and governors every year. Annual re-election will reassure everyone that they are the right person to lead a school to success (and not failure!).

attributes.action: To have the DCPC stopped
attributes.background:
HGV drivers have held there licences for years and then to be told to do a DCPC course is a disgace to the industry. You can take the same modules 5 times over, how can this help?

We will lose good professional drivers due to the costs.
attributes.additional_details: hgv driver for 20 years, transport manager for 20 years,

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of animal furs sourced from wild animals
attributes.background:
There is a trend for the use of animals sourced for fur to make fashion garments
There are garments manufactured unsustainability from wild sources killed unethically & in manners that result in extreme suffering for the animal
As more companies buy these furs, the wild animals needlessly suffer

attributes.action: I think school should be held Monday to Wednesday, giving us a longer weekend
attributes.background: I believe that having school five days a week makes kids feel more negatively towards having to drag themselves there everyday. I think that if we reduce this to three days per week then kids will have a more positive attitude towards school and take more information in. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: My evidence is that I am a pupil that doesn’t particularly enjoy school and the amount of work to complete each week. If school time is reduced by a couple days per week then I would learn more. However, if this petition was approved holiday times would also need to be reduced, but not enough that we’re still at school the same amount of time.

attributes.action: Tell schools to take sickness into account for attendance awards
attributes.background: Children with constant hospital appointments never get attendance awards. It’s not fair if others have fun and they don’t just because they have a medical condition.
attributes.additional_details: I think we should still have rewards but it would not count on their attendance if they have any kind of an appointment (with proof) or is sick. The Government’s guidance should say this.

attributes.action: Make sexual harassment a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Women in universities are subject to repeated sexual harassment at university. Unlike employees, students still need to work and be supervised by the perpetrator.
attributes.additional_details: Predators should not be allowed to work with the students they abuse. The police often can't do anything. The only option is to get a solicitor involved, which is challenging on a student wage.

attributes.action: Give Northern Ireland a vote on whether to accept the backstop
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is a change in constitutional status, and the people of Northern Ireland are being denied their rights to vote on whether they support that change for themselves or whether they vote for their own specific backstop.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-belfast-agreement

attributes.action: Introduce a subject covering covering current events to the secondary curriculum
attributes.background: After completing my GCSEs last summer, I noticed that there were a lack of subjects explaining current events that will effect my future, and I believe, as a school's purpose is to educate their students, and prepare them for their future, a class covering current events would help prepare them.
attributes.additional_details: Adding a 'current events' subject to the secondary curriculum across the UK would help greatly in making the students more aware of the world that they're about to go into.

attributes.action:
Ban alcohol advertising.
Label all alcohol with correct health & safety warning
attributes.background: I started drinking alcohol from a young age without any advice or warning of the dangers of this addictive drug. It has caused me much misery and I have witnessed much misery. There needs to be more education to help save lives to help save our children.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol kills around 3 million people a year. It destroys lives, it destroys relationships. It is an addictive drug and shouldn’t be advertised. It shouldn’t be attractively packaged and should be labelled with all the health and safety warnings. We need to help save future generations.

attributes.action: Provide Sirius minerals with full Loan Guarantee from HM treasury.
attributes.background: Sirius minerals is currently building a multi billion pound fertilizer mine in Yorkshire which will boost exports and create thousands of jobs locally and nationally.  the government as of today will not fully support this project with loan guarantees.
attributes.additional_details: The government will not take a stand and guarantee the jobs for thousands of UK workers in the form of a FULL loan guarantee, all the time companies are currently making redundancies, Jaguar Land rover for instance currently set to make 4000 plus redundant. Get your priorities straight, stop squabbling about Brexit which is eroding this country and fund this project, your country needs it.

attributes.action: The UK to apply to join the Schengen Agreement
attributes.background: The Schengen Agreement guarantees border check-free travel for people within its member states. The UK should apply to join Schengen immediately to avoid travel disruption after Brexit. It's not necessary to be in the EU or EEA to join. Switzerland isn't a member of either, but is in Schengen.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK joins Schengen, there will be no more passport checks at Dover or Calais. People will be able to enter and leave the UK without any checks. This could hugely benefit the UK economy in terms of trade, open migration and tourism. It will also help the UK to develop a more humane policy towards asylum-seekers and refugees. If the UK joins Schengen, no-one will need to risk their life trying to cross the Channel by dinghy anymore.

attributes.action: Regulate fitness professional qualifications and ban fast track courses.
attributes.background: The fitness industry is suffering from underqualifed and inexperienced people masquerading as “professionals” due to fast track courses. We ask For a set standard for the qualification of both “fitness instructor” and “personal trainer” positions to avoid public injury and dangerous misinformation.

attributes.action: Parents who do Not Exercise their Duties, should lose their Parental Rights!
attributes.background: I want the law to change by taking parental responsibility from inactive parents, this would give ease to the 'Actual' Responsible Parents. It would prevent parents who are not involved in their children’s’ lives taking decisions whether it’s good for their welfare or not.
attributes.additional_details:
Absent Parents having Parental Responsibility, creates more pain & stress for the Active parent, making decisions difficult, such as: 
-Whether or not a child has medical treatment. 
-Child’s name change 
-Consent for a child go holiday etc.
 
Like being a single hardworking parent isn't difficult enough, Imagine having to ask a careless or abusive ex for "permission", or the stress & cost of courts, having to explain why we shouldn't need to get permission from an "Absent" (by choice) parent.

attributes.action: Make drinking water free of charge inside the airports and train stations.
attributes.background: It's a great shame that you have to pay for drinking water at the airport, not even that but it is often way to overpriced. In a world full of gready businesses, where the proffits in this field reach hundreds of millions come join and let's make them give something back.

attributes.action: Allow more funding for Ex-Military and Ex-Service personnel suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: It is far too common for our Ex- Service and Ex-Military personnel to be suffering with PTSD. People who suffer from PTSD often suffer from nightmares, flashbacks, difficulty sleeping, and feeling emotionally numb. These symptoms can significantly impair a person's daily life.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should the people who fought so hard for our lives be the ones left to suffer?

PTSD is marked by clear physical and psychological symptoms. It often has symptoms like depression, substance abuse, problems of memory and cognition, and other physical and mental health problems. The disorder is also associated with difficulties in social or family life, including occupational instability, marital problems, family discord, and difficulties in parenting.

REF- https://www.military.com/benefits/veterans-health-care/posttraumatic-stress-disorder-overview.html

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Improve the recruiting drive for the British armed forces.
attributes.background: I don’t feel enough is being done, as a current applicant myself I can see simply not enough is being done. We need to bring back recruiting ads to TV, make the application process more appealing to a civilian and improve the quality of ad, in particular the army (look at the Royal Marines adverts).

attributes.action: Reinstate the Senior care worker on the job shortage list (Tier 2 visa General)
attributes.background: All care sectors across the UK, have benefited from staffing through Senior care workers being on job shortage list (Tier 2 General). Since the removal of this profession from the list it has been increasingly difficult for employers to find staff to work  senior care job roles.
attributes.additional_details: Care settings such as NHS, private residential homecare, nursing homes and domiciliary care have all benefited for this profession being on the job shortage list.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Make it law for all road users who do not indicate when turning, to pay a fine.
attributes.background:
I'm getting sick & tired of inconsiderate road users, whether they are operating a car, van, truck, motorcycle or bicycle. 
How many times have you sat at a busy junction & thought "if only this car wasn't coming across my path, I'd be able to get across". Only for them to turn without indicating!

attributes.action: Change age limit for large engine cars as it is for motorbikes
attributes.background: I want it changed as is for motorbikes so young people can not drive cars above a 1.2 engine till they are 25 so can help reduce risk of fatal or life changing injures
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was in car crash with young lad at wheel in large engine car and crashed car ended up on roof and she was injured two broken ankles deep cut to leg and now has too have two surgery

attributes.action: Stop firework work displays  on armistice Sunday
attributes.background: Today  on the 11/11/2018 silence fell at 11am to mark 100 years  of the first world war and  silence was across  the globe. No fireworks on this day
